subject: Learning
title: Old Dogs, New Tricks: Lifelong Learning
description: Learn Old Dogs, New Tricks: Lifelong Learning in one minute.

hook.text: A 70-year-old starts learning piano. Neighbors say it's too late. Neuroscience disagrees.

buildup.text: The myth that adults can't learn new things comes from confusing speed with ability.

discovery.text: Older adults learn more slowly but retain knowledge as well as younger adults when given enough time.

twist.text: They even have advantages: richer schemas, better pattern recognition, and stronger motivation.

climax.text: Neuroplasticity doesn't end. It slows, but the brain forms new connections at any age.

punchline.text: You can teach an old dog new tricks. Just be patient.

quiz.question: What advantage do older adults have in learning?
options: Richer schemas and better pattern recognition from experience
Faster processing speed than young adults
They don't need practice to learn new skills
